channel.title: Classes that are good where they're at
channel.description:
We always talk about what classes need fixing but never talk about which classes are fine :thinking:
I would like to share my personal list:
- Chronomancer - Court Wizard - Drunk - Hunter - Knight - Observer - Physician - Reaper - Possessor - Sorcerer - Inquisitor - Sellsword - Unseen converts - Cult converts - Cult Leader
Actually, there are some things I don't like.
Like decide fate killing king with arrow.
Exhume revealing NK and saying "alch" when NK is king.
Sorcerer not being able to use both day abilities in the same day (which makes the class the most frustrating to use).
But they are minor.

item.source: Classes that are good where they're at

item.title: Classes that are good where they're at
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
It’s too hard to disguise as Scorned. If it were up to me, disguise would remain on a target until you disguised someone else. You can’t disguise an imprisoned target even though sometimes that’s when you’re most certain they will be executed the next day.

And disguise should be infinite use.

Read full topic

item.source: Classes that are good where they're at

item.title: Classes that are good where they're at
item.dc:creator: Shrimpy
item.description:
Amelia:

You can’t be reasonably sure there isn’t another. That’s gambler’s fallacy.

I don’t think it’s gambler’s fallacy if Fool is second Neutral, since a third neutral is not guaranteed.

I like Seeker, it gives you a ton of info. Both observer abilities in one. You can figure out support classes from that and if someone is Prince or Hunter.

Read full topic
item.source: Classes that are good where they're at

item.title: Classes that are good where they're at
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
A NK that has anti-king/election abilities and becomes more powerful as king would be interesting. Not sure how you’d balance it though. You’d have to make the normal one weak enough that you want to be king, but not weak enough that you would die instantly.

Read full topic

item.source: Classes that are good where they're at

item.title: Classes that are good where they're at
item.dc:creator: RHCube
item.description:
Which is why it’s a problem. Since inq is anti-BD it shouldn’t be able to side BD, yet it does.

Amelia:

But since “muh neutral variety”

IMO I’d rather have 3 good neutrals than 3 good and 1 broken neutral. Also, they could just replace it. For example, bring Pretender back but rework it so it works similar to Inq(Checking if someone has Royal Blood)

Read full topic
